intro: Descurainia incisa subsp. paysonii, commonly known as Payson's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately divided leaves with a distinctive, somewhat succulent texture. The subspecies is characterized by its unique leaf morphology and is often found in arid environments.
